intro: Ceropegia tihamana, commonly known as the Madagascar star vine, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and tuberous roots. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, often with a distinctive corona. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is adapted to rocky or limestone soils. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
